subtitle: The tart sweetness of blackberries works perfectly with lamb. An ideal roast for two, but the recipe can be easily increased to serve more.

method.text: Put the lamb in a lightly oiled roasting tin. Mix together the honey, mustard, olive oil and garlic. Brush the lamb wtih half the glaze.

Cook in the oven for 20 min. Stir the rosemary into the remaining glaze. Brush over the lamb. Cook for a further 10-15 min or until lamb is cooked to your liking. Transfer to a serving dish. Keep warm.
To make the sauce: Fry the onion in the roasting tin juices for 5 min, until lightly browned. Pour in the stock and vinegar. Bring to the boil.
Add <sup>3</sup>/<sub>4</sub> of the blackberries and the bay leaf to the pan. Boil for about 4 min until sauce has reduced by half. Strain, pressing thoroughly all the juice from the blackberries.
Return the sauce to a clean pan. Add remaining blackberries. Season. Simmer for 1 min.
Thickly slice the lamb. Spoon over the sauce.

title: Lamb with blackberry sauce
